app.title: Icon Rendering Performance Test Suite
app.subtitle: Comprehensive testing platform for comparing rendering performance across different icon formats: CSS, SVG, PNG, GIF, JPEG, WebP, and AVIF.
app.description: Test the same icon implementation across multiple formats to measure load times, memory usage, and rendering performance.
format.css.title: CSS Implementation
format.css.description: Icon font, pure CSS with transforms, and minimal CSS implementations. Statistical analysis with 2,000 iterations including p-values, confidence intervals, and power analysis.
format.svg.title: SVG Implementation
format.svg.description: Scalable Vector Graphics implementations - inline, external, and optimised variants.
format.png.title: PNG Implementation
format.png.description: PNG raster images at various resolutions and optimisation levels.
format.gif.title: GIF Implementation
format.gif.description: GIF format variations including standard and optimised versions.
format.jpeg.title: JPEG Implementation
format.jpeg.description: JPEG variants with different quality and compression settings.
format.webp.title: WebP Implementation
format.webp.description: Modern WebP format with lossless and lossy compression options.
format.avif.title: AVIF Implementation
format.avif.description: Next-generation AVIF format with superior compression efficiency.
dashboard.title: Performance Summary
dashboard.description: Comprehensive dashboard with cross-format performance analysis, statistical comparisons, and data export.
dashboard.features.aggregates: Aggregates results from all test formats
archive.title: Past Results Archive
archive.description: Complete historical record of all performance tests with full reproducibility data and system information.
methodology.title: Test Methodology
methodology.description: Each format implementation tests the same icon design - a code slash symbol (</>) within a blue-to-teal gradient container. This ensures consistent visual comparison across formats.
methodology.metrics: Performance metrics include load times, memory usage, rendering performance, file sizes, and browser compatibility. All tests use the same 48√ó48 pixel container for standardisation.
methodology.vector.title: Vector Formats
methodology.raster.title: Raster Formats
methodology.metrics.title: Metrics
summary.dashboard.title: Performance Summary Dashboard
summary.dashboard.description: Comprehensive analysis and comparison of icon rendering performance across all tested formats.
language.selector.label: Language:
notice.current_description: This performance testing suite is designed for in-browser testing only. All experimental test results are specific to the browser environment in which they are executed (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, etc.) and include comprehensive browser identification in exported data.
notice.future_description: A future project version may provide CLI tools for automated multi-browser testing and comparison. The current version focuses on providing accurate, reproducible results within a single browser environment for scientific validity.
summary.title: Performance Summary Dashboard
summary.subtitle: Comprehensive analysis and comparison of icon rendering performance across all tested formats.
summary.browser_notice_desc: All performance data shown is specific to the browser environment where tests were executed
summary.no_data_desc: No performance test results found. Run some tests to see comparative analysis here.
summary.chart.render_title: Average Rendering Time by Format and Implementation
summary.stats.no_data: No statistical analysis data available. Run tests with multiple implementations to see statistical comparisons.
summary.clear_confirm: Are you sure you want to clear all test data? This action cannot be undone.
summary.clear_success: All test data has been cleared.
past.title: Past Test Results Archive
past.subtitle: Complete historical record of icon performance tests with full reproducibility data.
past.browser_notice_desc: Each archived result includes browser identification and is specific to its execution environment
past.import_invalid_format: Please select a valid JSON file.
past.import_parse_error: Failed to parse JSON file. Please check the file format.
past.import_all_duplicates: All entries already exist in history.
past.import_no_valid_data: No valid test results found in the file.
past.system_specs_desc: Test results now include comprehensive system information in exports.
past.system_specs_note: Configure system specs in the main testing interface to ensure your exported results include hardware details for scientific reproducibility.
past.future_dev_desc: A future project version may provide CLI tools for automated multi-browser testing and comparison. The current version focuses on accurate, reproducible results within individual browser environments.
css.test_single: Single Icon Test (2,000 iterations per type)
css.progress_note: Background progress estimation only ‚Ä¢ No measurement delays
css.belarc_recommendation: Recommended: Use Belarc Advisor to collect comprehensive system specs for scientific reproducibility
css.no_tests_message: No tests run yet. Click "Start Stress Test" to begin performance analysis.
css.live_rendering_desc: This tab shows the icons being rendered in real-time during performance testing. Switch to this tab after starting a test to watch the rendering process.
css.no_test_running: No test running. Start a performance test to see live rendering.
past.confirm_clear: Are you sure you want to clear all test history? This cannot be undone.
sysspec.belarc_desc: For comprehensive system information, we recommend using Belarc Advisor (free tool) to generate a detailed system report. This ensures accurate hardware specifications for scientific reproducibility.
sysspec.belarc_step2: Run the tool to generate your system report
sysspec.belarc_step3: Save the report as an HTML file (File ‚Üí Save As)
sysspec.belarc_step4: Click "Import Belarc Report" below to auto-fill fields
sysspec.ph_model: e.g., MSI GE72 6QF Rev 1.0 Gaming Laptop
sysspec.ph_boot: e.g., UEFI with Secure Boot enabled
sysspec.ph_igpu: e.g., Intel HD Graphics 530 (shares system memory)
sysspec.ph_driver: e.g., NVIDIA Driver 472.12, Intel Graphics Driver 27.20.100.9466
sysspec.ph_sys_drive: e.g., 128GB Toshiba THNSNJ128G8NY SSD (Boot drive C:)
sysspec.ph_add_drives: e.g., 1TB HGST HTS721010A9E630 HDD (Storage drives D:, F:)
sysspec.ph_perf_notes: e.g., SSD system drive ensures consistent load times
sysspec.ph_net_conn: e.g., Intel Dual Band Wireless-AC 3165 @ 72 Mbps
sysspec.confirm_clear: Clear all system information fields? This will reset to default values.
sysspec.save_success: System information saved successfully! This will be included in your test result exports.
sysspec.save_error: Failed to save system information. Please try again.
sysspec.import_invalid: Please select an HTML file exported from Belarc Advisor.
sysspec.import_success: Belarc report imported successfully! Review the fields and click Save.
sysspec.import_partial: Could not extract all fields. Some data may have been imported ‚Äî please review and complete manually.
sysspec.import_error: Failed to parse the Belarc report. Please check the file format.
library.title: Results Library
library.subtitle: Browse, filter, and manage all test run records.
